commit_list.message: Returns the actual rule without the surrounding hash.
Adds classes to interact with states and state types.
Adds two more classes that make the possible StateOperator and ValueOperator accessible.
Adds code and methods to delete rules or show their details.
Bumps the version up to 0.0.10
Adds eventmachine related classes that enable the streaming of events to clients.
Fixes the creation of rules and adds a RuleType class.
Prints the received errors to give more feedback.
Pulls the guh connection settings from the ENV variables.
Introduces a new parameter to the Guh::Device.add method; this might change in the future;
Adapts the gem to reflect the new guh core API
honour the new status code in the response envelope
use a string instead of a symbol to access descriptorId
discoverable devices can now be created
Removes a bunch of unnecessary puts.
Fixes API call parameters to match the new guh core and unifies the use of whitespace at the end of lines and files.
minor version bump; added url and description to gemspec;
now we can add and remove devices
added method to use the new "discover" feature; does not work until issue #13 is resolved;
using the vendors key is no longer necessary
make sure there is an array we can iterate
return the vendors array straigt away
welcome message does no longer contain a status field
we can now search for a specific DeviceClass by its id
split Device class into two classes: Device & DeviceClass
wrap the params for actions in a list of hashes; added a convenience method to achieve this more easily;
use the welcome message again; raise an exception if the connection fails;
see if an action was successfully executed an raise an exception if not
use yard for documentation
added a class for Vendors to retrieve a list of supported vendors
guh-core disconnects automatically now, so we dont have to do it
fixed all the tests to honor the Plugin changes
Guh::Device.add raises an exception now if something went wrong
fixed error where Wrapper is waiting for guh's welcome message (which is not coming at the moment)
transitioned code from old Hive to new Guh name
use a different device; use the new responses;
use the new way of accessing returned data
Base.get gives us the response['params'] value and not the full response
added code and tests for rules
use the helper to create an elro switch
added a helper for faster device creation
lets use guard to continously run the tests
Triggers are now called events; added some code to retrieve EventTypes supported by devices;
fixed the tests after the status/success confusion
added a convenience method to plot JSON responses while running tests
checking for success & error properly
added code and tests for Actions
Rspec is deprecated, use RSpec instead
retrieve the list of loaded plugins
don't run this test until the RPC/API is fixed
added RPC/API call for ActionType and a test
added documentation and proper API call to TriggerType wrapper
removed the unnecessary "before :all" calls from the spec files
delete the users config files to purge all configured devices & rules --> WORKAROUND until we get RPC/API calls for this
wrote some tests for the Wrapper Base
Removed need for fake hive server; added tests and methods for Device Wrapper;
echo the received lines
fixed missing self
socket is in std-lib, no need to add it as dependency; add a few more RPC calls;
initial import
removed the Rails version dependency
change the dependency to Rails 4.0
Fixes the casing of the *ID attributes in StateDescriptor JSON.
